rooms.Name: Northwest end of Concourse
rooms.Description:
You are at the concourse, the city wall is just west.  A small promenade
goes east, and the bridge is just north of here.  The concourse continues
south along the city wall.

rooms.Name: Promenade
rooms.Description:
The river gently flows west just north of here.  The promenade continues
further east and to the west you see the city wall.  Park Road leads south
from here.

rooms.Name: Promenade
rooms.Description:
The river gently flows west just north of here.  The promenade continues
both east and west.  South of here you see the entrance to the park, and a
small building seems to be just west of the entrance.

rooms.Name: Promenade
rooms.Description:
The river gently flows west just north of here.  The promenade continues
both east and west.  A small path leads south.  Looking across the river you
see the levee.

rooms.Name: Northeast end of Concourse
rooms.Description:
A the northeast end of the concourse, the smooth stone of the city wall
blocks the way east.  The great paving blocks that make up the roadway
here give way to the small stones of Mockingbird Lane which wanders to
the north.  A large, black bird sits in a tree overhead, looking down
at you speculatively.  South, the concourse follows the city wall.

Exits.Description: Mockingbird Lane wanders north from here.

ExtraDescs.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

rooms.Name: Park Entrance
rooms.Description:
You are standing just inside the small park of Midgaard.  To the north is
the promenade and a small path leads south into the park.  To your east is
the famous Park Cafe.

rooms.Name: Park Cafe
rooms.Description:
You are inside Park Cafe, a very cozy place with many tables and seats
where you can relax and enjoy the view.  To the east you can see the 
entrance to the park.

rooms.Name: Small path through the park
rooms.Description:
You are walking along a small path through the park.  The path continues
south and east.

rooms.Name: Small path in the park
rooms.Description:
You are standing on a small path inside the park.  The park entrance is
just north of here, and Park Cafe is just east of the entrance.  The path
leads further east and west.

Exits.Description: You see the northern park entrance.

rooms.Name: Small path in the park
rooms.Description:
You are on a small path running through the park.  It continues west and
south and just north of here you see the southern wall of Park Cafe.

rooms.Name: Cityguard Headquarters
rooms.Description: You are inside a tidy office.

rooms.Name: Park Road
rooms.Description:
The road continues north and south.  A building is just west of here, you
notice a sign on the door.  The park entrance is to the east.

Exits.Description: You see the cityguard head quarters.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The sign on the door says:-

                 Cityguard Head Quarters

           WARNING: Authorized Personnel Only!

rooms.Name: Western Park Entrance
rooms.Description:
You are standing at the western end of the park.  A small path leads east
into the park and going west through the entrance you will reach Park Road.

rooms.Name: A path in the park
rooms.Description:
You are in the park.  The paths lead north and west.  Westward is the
park entrance and to the east you see a small pond.

Exits.Description: You see the western park entrance.

rooms.Name: The Pond
rooms.Description:
You are swimming around in the pond, feeling rather stupid.  You can get
back on the path from the eastern and western end of the pond.

rooms.Name: A path in the park
rooms.Description:
You are in the park.  The paths lead north and east.  Eastward is the
park entrance and to the west you see a small pond.

rooms.Name: Eastern Park Entrance
rooms.Description:
You are standing at the eastern end of the park.  A small path leads west
into the park.  Going east through the entrance you will reach Emerald
Avenue.

rooms.Name: Emerald Avenue
rooms.Description:
You are standing on the north end of Emerald Avenue.  To the north is the
promenade and to the west is the park entrance.  To the east is the not very
big Town Hall of Midgaard.

rooms.Name: Park Road
rooms.Description:
You are on Park Road which leads north and south.
A cottage is just east of here.

Exits.Description: You see a small cottage with an oaken door.  A name plate has been set on it.

ExtraDescs.Description: The name 'Papi Llon' has been carved into the name plate.

rooms.Name: Emerald Avenue
rooms.Description: You are standing on Emerald Avenue.  The road leads north and south.

rooms.Name: Road Crossing
rooms.Description:
You are in the middle of the road cross.  Roads lead in all directions.
A huge black iron chain as thick as a tree trunk is fastened into the ground
at the center of the road cross.  Its other end leads directly upwards towards
the sky.
A road sign is here.

Exits.Description: The chain disappears in the clouds.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The chain reaches the clouds high above you.  It must take some really
powerful magic to hold such a chain in place.

The sign points in all directions:

   North - Emerald Avenue.
   East  - Park Road.
   South - Emerald Avenue.
   West  - Park Road.

Someone has added the following with red paint:

   Up    - Redferne's Flying Citadel.

rooms.Name: Emerald Avenue
rooms.Description:
You are standing at a bend on Emerald Avenue.  The road leads south and
east.

rooms.Name: Park Road
rooms.Description:
You are on Park Road which leads south and north.  Elm Street is east of
here.

rooms.Name: Elm Street
rooms.Description:
You are on Elm street.  Park Road is to the west and Elm Street continues
in eastward direction.

rooms.Name: The end of Elm street
rooms.Description:
You are at the end of Elm Street.
An old elm tree grows here.

ExtraDescs.Description: The fresh young leaves of the elm tree wave gently in the wind.

rooms.Name: Emerald Avenue
rooms.Description:
You are on Emerald Avenue which continues north.  The Concourse is south
of here.

rooms.Name: Park Road
rooms.Description:
You are on Park Road which continues north.  The Concourse is south of
here.
An old two-story house is to the east.

Exits.Description: A heavy oaken door is to the east.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The house is obviously very old and needs painting.  The heavy oaken door is
equipped with a brass door knocker shaped as a goblin's head.  No name plate
is to be seen anywhere.

As you look at it, the goblin door knocker comes alive!

The head splutters 'Tiz iz da houze uff Kwiff...  Kuiffe...  Qwiff...  Erhm...'
The head splutters 'Quiff...  Quiffil...  Ne'er mind!  Quiffy livez ere!'

It opens its mouth wide and gobbles 'Unlokk me!'

rooms.Name: On the Concourse
rooms.Description:
You are at the southwest corner of the city wall.  The Concourse leads
both north and east.

rooms.Name: On the Concourse
rooms.Description:
The Concourse continues both east and west.  Emerald Avenue is north of
here.

rooms.Name: On the Concourse
rooms.Description:
The Concourse continues both east and west.  Park Road is north of here
and an iron grate leads south to the graveyard.

Exits.Description: Through the solid iron bars you see the graveyard.

rooms.Name: On the Concourse
rooms.Description:
You are at the southeast corner of the city wall.  The Concourse leads
both north and west.

rooms.Name: Park Road
rooms.Description: You are at Park Road which continues north and south.

rooms.Name: Emerald Avenue
rooms.Description:
You are at Emerald Avenue which continues north and south.  Penny Lane leads
east from here.

rooms.Name: Emerald Avenue
rooms.Description:
You are standing at a bend on Emerald Avenue.  To the east the road goes on
and to the south is the Road Crossing.

rooms.Name: Emerald Avenue
rooms.Description:
You are standing at a bend on Emerald Avenue.  To the west the road goes on
and to the north is the Road Crossing.

rooms.Name: Park Road
rooms.Description:
You are at a bend on Park Road.  To the north the road goes on and to the
east is the Road Crossing.

rooms.Name: Park Road
rooms.Description:
You are at a bend on Park Road.  To the south the road goes on and to the
west is the Road Crossing.

rooms.Name: The Waiting Room
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the waiting room at the town hall.  Wooden chairs stand
along the walls and a long desk with a typewriter is placed in the middle of
the room.

Exits.Description: It looks like some kind of office.
The exit west leads to Emerald Avenue.

ExtraDescs.Description:
An extremely heavy desk.  It is so large that it doesn't even need drawers.
Everything can be stored on its top.

It is an ancient Quifatronic T-1000 mk I.  These machines are known for their
incredible durability, and for their even more incredible weight.  They make
a Cray II look like a laptop.

rooms.Name: The Mayor's Office
rooms.Description:
You are in the not very big office of the Mayor of Midgaard.  A large and
polished but completely empty desk is standing in front of an armchair that
looks so comfortable that it most of all resembles a bed with the head end
raised slightly.

Exits.Description: The waiting room is to the west.

ExtraDescs.Description:
This desk is obviously very old.  Nevertheless it looks as if has never been
used.

This chair is really a masterpiece.  A chair where one can sit as comfortably
as in a bed.  All auditoriums should be equipped with these things.  A shame
that there wouldn't be room for the students too, though.

rooms.Name: Penny Lane
rooms.Description:
You are on Penny Lane.  Emerald Avenue is to the west and Penny Lane
continues in eastward direction.

rooms.Name: Penny Lane
rooms.Description: You are on Penny Lane.  The narrow road continues north and west.

rooms.Name: End of Penny Lane
rooms.Description: You are at the end of Penny Lane.  The only exit appears to be south.

rooms.Name: Reimbursement File Update Room
rooms.Description:
-----
There's nothing unusual about this small 10' by 10' room.  Nothing except
for a door located to your south.  There's a large sign next to that door
and it's glowing as though it begs for your attention.  The words on that
sign look important, please read it before you pass through this door!
-----
PLEASE READ THIS SIGN BEFORE OPENING THIS DOOR! (GLOWING)

Exits.Description:
Behind this door is a DT, please, please, read the sign before going in
there!

ExtraDescs.Description:
There's a Deathtrap (DT) behind this door.  The purpose for this DT is to
help players get their reimbursement files updated.  It's the most convient
way to get an update since accidental pwipes can happen at anytime.  There
will be no con lost if you die in this DT so don't worry.  If you suspect
your corpse has been looted by someone, please contact an immort asap or if
there is no immort on to help you, please mail Bigh or Jahana.
* We are not responsible if you do not come back in time to retrieve your
  corpse.  If it is left sitting there and your corpse dissolves, it will
  become fair game for anyone who picks up the gear.

rooms.Name: LAST CHANCE!  NEWBIES BEWARE!  WARNING: DEATHTRAP SOUTH OF HERE!
rooms.Description:
-----
You can feel DEATH's numbing cold fingers as she tickles your spine.  To
the south, there's a cloud of strange green gas coming to your direction.
You still have a chance to run back to the door but you remember that the
reason you're here is to receive that reimbursement file update.  Go south
if you are ready to DIE.
-----

Exits.Description: This exit would take you back to the room you came from.
If you are ready to die, just walk into that room south of here!

rooms.Name: THE GAS CHAMBER (Reimbursement File Update Successful!)
rooms.Description:
-----
Just as soon as you enter this room, a cloud of thick gas surrounds you.
You choke as you gasp for air!  The lethal toxic fumes you breathed in are
giving you excruciating pain in your lungs.  You're beginning to slowly
drop to the floor as your screams of agony go unnoticed.
If you did actually survive this DT, please walk back north and re-enter
this room again.
-----

rooms.Name: On Mockingbird Lane
rooms.Description:
Small stones pave a dark lane which wanders north through a very old
area of town.  Huge trees grow on either side reaching out over the
way in a fashion that seems almost menacing rather than protective.
A large, dark bird croaks harshly, looking down from the heights.

rooms.Name: On Mockingbird Lane
rooms.Description:
The cobbles of Mockingbird Lane are hard underfoot and every sound
rings loudly, echoing slightly.  The dark trees on either side make the
way here dim, no matter if it be night or day.  In the bushes along side 
path, small, bright eyes glitter, looking out curiously.

rooms.Name: Entrance to the Psionicist's Guild
rooms.Description:
As you walk into this place, your mind is assaulted by buzzing and static.
Small items on your person leap out of pockets and bags as neophite
psionicists try to harness the power of their minds.  Scraps of conversations
fill your ears, though you realize they are actually being projected into
your head.  There is an interesting little creature next to the door who mews
at some of the people entering.  Perhaps this little monster can detect
latent psionics.  Looking around you see the exit to the back room covered by
a heavy tarp that is pulled back to allow people entrance.

rooms.Name: The Bar of Psionicists
rooms.Description:
A waiter sits behind the counter, as bottles and glasses move around the room
by themselves.  You realize he must be controlling them with his mind.  It is
completely quiet, though looking carfully you can see people's facial
expressions change as silent discussions take place.  A plate of food
suddenly bursts into flame and just as quickly, the flames die down, leaving
the stak underneath done just perfectly.  There certainly do seem to be
advanages to having a psionic barkeep.

rooms.Name: The Psionicists' Practice Yard
rooms.Description:
The heavy curtain falls back down behind you, and you immediately discern
it's purpose as a good sized chunk of the floor explodes right next to you.
Miraculously, though it was scant inches from your feet, you remain unharmed.
You can see similar holes throughout the floor, and off to the rear of the
building you see mortar and stones floating down to patch holes on that side
of the room.  Scorch marks line the walls, and you see several students
around the yard practicing their art.  At least you assume they are, it's
pretty hard to tell.

rooms.Name: A paved road
rooms.Description:
You're standing on a road paved with a layer of gravel.  To the west, the
East Gate of Migaard is located there and to the east, this road extends
further to that direction.  This simple paved road has an intersection
that'll take you south and north of here to some charted area.
